byline.original: By JIM COLLINS and MORTEN T. HANSEN

abstract: Jim Collins and Morten T Hansen essay contends Bill Gates and other hugely successful entrepreneurs may have had good fortune in their lives, but they knew how to turn those lucky breaks into life-changing events; presents results of study of entrepreneurs' companies that outperformed their industries by factor of 10.
snippet: Bill Gates and other hugely successful entrepreneurs may have had good fortune in their lives, but they knew how to turn those lucky breaks into life-changing events.
lead_paragraph: Bill Gates and other hugely successful entrepreneurs may have had good fortune in their lives, but they knew how to turn those lucky breaks into life-changing events.

headline.main: What’s Luck Got to Do With It?
headline.print_headline: What's Luck Got to Do With It?
headline.seo: Luck Is Just the Spark for Business Giants
